metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3135 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the xt_alloc_table_info function in net/netfilter/x_tables.c in the Linux kernel through 4.5.2 on 32-bit platforms allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via an IPT_SO_SET_REPLACE setsockopt call. Ben Hawkes discovered an integer overflow in the Linux netfilter implementation. On systems running 32 bit kernels, a local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-34-generic - 4.2.0-34.39~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-34.39~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-34-lowlatency - 4.2.0-34.39~14.04.1

No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> possibly introduced with 711bdde6a884354ddae8da2fcb495b2a9364cc90 affects 4.2 and newer

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-wily package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-34.39~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53~14.04.1').
